sub_title: Matching idea and IT @ Pick my Brain
summary:
My mission: Happier customers and developers through clear, complete and concise functional design. 

I'm a requirements analyst / functional designer, translating the business needs of the client into clear specifications for the programmer. As an Industrial Design Engineer with elaborate experience in IT and application development, I am the link between the client, designer and programmer. I've lived in Thailand and China and speak Thai and Mandarin. Furthermore I've worked with Bulgarian programmers in my previous job. Combining this I'm specializing in transferring software requirements to software development teams here and abroad (offshoring/outsourcing), in East Asia and Eastern Europe. I'm a Certified Scrum Product Owner and expert in making clear, concise and complete requirements in an Agile / Scrum environment. 

Specialties: IT, Requirements analysis, Scrum, Agile, user stories, use cases, functional design, usability, telemedicine, emerging markets, bottom of the pyramid, cross-cultural communication, IT offshoring

treasury_media.description: As a requirements analyst I often hear 'Oh we don't do specifications, we do Scrum!' Although fewer specs are needed in a true Scrum environment with an experie

certifications.name: Professional Scrum Product Owner™ II (PSPO II)

projects.title: Dutch National Police
projects.description: The Dutch National Police uses software to analyze fingerprints and faces of suspects and crime scenes. My job is to analyze the needs of the users and translate those to specifications for the software provider, IDEMIA. I was previously working for IDEMIA and am now working for the Police.

projects.description: The website webuildhomes.nl was developed by Up2 Technology. I trained the team of the client in managing the site content with Wordpress. Furthermore I created a manual for all the customizations that were done, in addition to the standard Wordpress documentation.

projects.title: WIJ
projects.description: I’ve created the functional design for the new version of WIJ.nl, a portal for pregnant women. Because the website had an enormous amount of features and articles, the functional design was an important step in getting clear the requirements of the customer and the possibilities of technology. Upon delivery I trained the entire content management team (12 people) in using the CMS (Drupal) and acceptance testing.

projects.title: Endinet data management plan
projects.description: At Endinet, the energy grid management company in the Eindhoven region, my task was to analyse which data is present in all systems used within the company, and which system is Master, Slave or Source for each of these data fields, now and in the future. I've developed a method to display this information, initially in Excel, but I also created the functional design for an application that was built in Oracle, with which this information can be managed.

profile_positions.description: Several positions in the national board and committees, such as EVP Business, EVP PR & Marketing, PM Social Media, final editor/editor in chief of the national JCI Magazine and chair of the mediation committee.
profile_positions.title: National officer

profile_positions.description: Junior Chamber International (JCI) is a global organization for young people who want to develop themselves personally and professionally and by doing so want to contribute to society. JCI Amsterdam International is the only English-speaking chapter in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Local member / officer

profile_positions.description: As the Executive Vice President for Europe, I was part of the global JCI Board of Directors and the Executive Committee. I was the chair of the Europe team, supporting the 5 Vice Presidents assigned to Europe, and chairing the meetings of the JCI National Presidents in Europe. My main goals were to stimulate knowledge exchange between National Organizations and improve the communication between the board and them.
profile_positions.title: Executive Vice President for Europe

profile_positions.description: Working on improvements of the skills development program for JCI members worldwide.
profile_positions.title: Skills Development Committee Chairperson

profile_positions.description: Mentoring JCI National Organizations and their members in Poland, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Bulgaria, Croatia, Turkey, Moldova, Ukraine and Russia.
profile_positions.title: Vice President
Skills Development Committee member for Europe

profile_positions.description: Up2 develops websites and web applications. As a functional designer I translate the requirements and wishes of the client and the graphic designer in something that the programmer can make. I document these requirements in a functional design that is readable for all parties, and that is the basis for the rest of the project. When the project is delivered, I check whether the delivered product meets the requirements, and I train the client in using the website or application and its Content Management System (CMS).
profile_positions.title: Functional Designer / PM

profile_positions.description:
KSYOS develops TeleMedical applications for consulting specialists. One application that is currently widely used among general practitioners in the Netherlands is TeleDermatology. When a general practitioner receives a patient with, a skin problem, he can take a picture of it with a digital camera provided by KSYOS, and send it to the dermatologist using our secure webbased application. The dermatologist replies within two days. 

My task here is to design the user interface, focusing on usability and considering demands from business, medical practice and IT, and to coordinate development of new telemedicine tools, cooperating with our external software programming parties.
